info.title: WSO2 API Manager - Publisher
info.description:
This document specifies a **RESTful API** for WSO2 **API Manager** - Publisher.

It is written with [swagger 2](http://swagger.io/).

get.description: Get a list of available APIs qualifying under a given search condition.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
**Search condition**.

You can search in attributes by using an **"attribute:"** modifier.

Eg. "provider:wso2" will match an API if the provider of the API contains "wso2".

Supported attribute modifiers are [**version, context, status,
description, subcontext, doc, provider, tag **]

If no advanced attribute modifier has been specified, search will match the
given query string against API Name.

200.description:
OK. 
List of qualifying APIs is returned.

Content-Type.description: The content type of the body.

ETag.description: Entity Tag of the response resource. Used by caches, or in conditional requests.

304.description:
Not Modified. 
Empty body because the client has already the latest version of the requested resource.

406.description:
Not Acceptable. 
The requested media type is not supported

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: API object that needs to be added

201.description:
Created. 
Successful response with the newly created API as entity in the body. Location header contains URL of newly created API.

Location.description: The URL of the newly created API.

400.description:
Bad Request. 
Invalid request or validation error

404.description:
Not Found. 
API to copy does not exist.

post.description: Change the lifecycle of an API

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
The action to demote or promote the state of the API.

Supported actions are [ **Publish, Deploy as a Prototype, Demote to Created, Demote to Prototyped, Block, Deprecate, Re-Publish, Retire **]

parameters.name: lifecycleChecklist
parameters.description:
You can specify additional checklist items by using an **"attribute:"** modifier.

Eg: "Deprecate Old Versions:true" will deprecate older versions of a particular API when it is promoted to 
Published state from Created state. Multiple checklist items can be given in "attribute1:true, attribute2:false"
format.

Supported checklist items are as follows.
1. **Deprecate Old Versions**: Setting this to true will deprecate older versions of a particular API when it is promoted to Published state from Created state.
2. **Require Re-Subscription**: If you set this to true, users need to re subscribe to the API although they may have subscribed to an older version.

ETag.description: Entity Tag of the changed API. Used by caches, or in conditional request.

Last-Modified.description:
Date and time the API lifecycle has been modified the last time. 
Used by caches, or in conditional requests.

400.description:
Bad Request. 
Invalid request or validation error

404.description:
Not Found. 
Requested API does not exist.

412.description:
Precondition Failed. 
The request has not been performed because one of the preconditions is not met.

get.description: Downloads a FILE type document/get the inline content or source url of a certain document.

200.description:

File or inline content returned.

Content-Type.description: The content type of the body.

ETag.description:
Entity Tag of the response resource.
Used by caches, or in conditional requests.

Last-Modified.description:
Date and time the resource has been modifed the last time. 
Used by caches, or in conditional reuquests.

303.description:
See Other.
Source can be retrived from the URL specified at the Location header.

Location.description: The Source URL of the document.

304.description:
Not Modified. 
Empty body because the client has already the latest version of the requested resource.

404.description:
Not Found. 
Requested Document does not exist.

406.description:
Not Acceptable. 
The requested media type is not supported

post.description:
Upload a file to a document or add inline content to the document.

Document's source type should be **FILE** in order to upload a file to the document using **file** parameter.
Document's source type should be **INLINE** in order to add inline content to the document using **inlineContent** parameter.

Only one of **file** or **inlineContent** can be specified at one time.

Location.description: The URL of the updated content of the document.

Content-Type.description: The content type of the body.

get.description: Get a list of gateway environments configured previously.

parameters.name: apiId
parameters.description: Will return environment list for the provided API.

Content-Type.description: The content type of the body.

ETag.description:
Entity Tag of the response resource. 
Used by caches, or in conditional requests.

304.description:
Not Modified. 
Empty body because the client has already the latest version of the requested resource.

404.description:
Not Found. 
Requested API does not exist.

apiId.name: apiId
apiId.description:
**API ID** consisting of the **UUID** of the API. 
The combination of the provider of the API, name of the API and the version is also accepted as a valid API ID.
Should be formatted as **provider-name-version**.

apiId-Q.name: apiId
apiId-Q.description:
**API ID** consisting of the **UUID** of the API. 
The combination of the provider of the API, name of the API and the version is also accepted as a valid API I.
Should be formatted as **provider-name-version**.

applicationId.name: applicationId
applicationId.description: **Application Identifier** consisting of the UUID of the Application.

tierLevel.name: tierLevel
tierLevel.description: List API or Application or Resource type tiers.

tierLevel-Q.name: tierLevel
tierLevel-Q.description: List API or Application or Resource type tiers.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Maximum size of resource array to return.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Starting point within the complete list of items qualified.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: Media types acceptable for the response. Default is JSON.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Media type of the entity in the body. Default is JSON.

If-None-Match.name: If-None-Match
If-None-Match.description:
Validator for conditional requests; based on the ETag of the formerly retrieved
variant of the resourec.

If-Modified-Since.name: If-Modified-Since
If-Modified-Since.description:
Validator for conditional requests; based on Last Modified header of the 
formerly retrieved variant of the resource.

If-Match.name: If-Match
If-Match.description: Validator for conditional requests; based on ETag.

If-Unmodified-Since.name: If-Unmodified-Since
If-Unmodified-Since.description: Validator for conditional requests; based on Last Modified header.

next.description:
Link to the next subset of resources qualified. 
Empty if no more resources are to be returned.

previous.description:
Link to the previous subset of resources qualified. 
Empty if current subset is the first subset returned.

APIInfo.title: API Info object with basic API details.

provider.description: If the provider value is not given, the user invoking the API will be used as the provider.

id.description: UUID of the api registry artifact

provider.description: If the provider value is not given user invoking the api will be used as the provider.

apiDefinition.description: Swagger definition of the API which contains details about URI templates and scopes

transport.description: Supported transports for the API (http and/or https).

gatewayEnvironments.description: Comma separated list of gateway environments.

attributes.description: Custom attributes added to the tier policy

requestCount.description: Maximum number of requests which can be sent within a provided unit time

tierPlan.description: This attribute declares whether this tier is available under commercial or free

stopOnQuotaReach.description:
By making this attribute to false, you are capabale of sending requests 
even if the request count exceeded within a unit time

Error.title: Error object returned with 4XX HTTP status

description.description: A detail description about the error message.

moreInfo.description: Preferably an url with more details about the error.

error.description:
If there are more than one error list them out. 
For example, list out validation errors by each field.

ErrorListItem.title: Description of individual errors that may have occurred during a request.
